div.p: Greenon Knights at Indian Valley were encouraged to be the I in Kind!
Congratulations to Greenon Men's Soccer, back-to-back OHC Champions!
Enon Primary staff members dressed as crayons for Halloween at school
Holocaust Survivor Dr. Al Miller, pictured with Greenon Student Ambassadors, spoke to 7th-12th Grade Students about his experiences in the Holocaust and World War II.
Congratulations to Greenon Football, the 2019 OHC Champions! The Greenon Knights finished 8-2 for only the 3rd time since 1981.
The Greenon Lemelson-MIT InvenTeam hosted Leigh Estabrooks, Invention Education Officer at MIT.

Welcome to the Greenon Local School District, home of the Knights! Greenon is the public school district serving students in the village of Enon, Mad River Township and Green Township, in Clark County, Ohio. Three schools serve about 1,600 students every day. Students in preschool through 1st grade attend Enon Primary. Second through 6th grade students attend Indian Valley Intermediate School. And 7th through 12th grade students attend Greenon Junior/Senior High School.

With an educational program enhanced by athletics and extracurricular opportunities, Greenon is proud to partner with supportive families and communities to offer outstanding educational opportunities in a close-knit, small-town environment. Most recently, the community generously supported a bond issue and the district is embarking on a facilities project to construct a new kindergarten through 12th grade facility on the grounds of Indian Valley in the village of Enon.

p.strong: Greenon, where success for every student is our mission every day!

img.alt: Greenon Teacher Tom Jenkins has been selected for the Excellence in Teaching Award by the Rotary Club of Springfield.
